piece.name: King
piece.description: The most important piece on the board.The king controls 8 squares on the board from the centre. It can move like a Queen, i.e., horizontally, vertically and diagonally, but can only move one square.

piece.name: Queen
piece.description: The queen controls 27 squares on the board from the centre. It is the strongest piece on the board. It can move both like a bishop, and like a rook, i.e., it can move horizontally, vertically and diagonally.

piece.name: Rook
piece.description: The Rook controls 14 squares on the board from the centre. It can only move horizontally and vertically.

piece.name: Bishop
piece.description: Bishop controls 13 squares on the board from the centre. Each bishop can only move on the diagonals of the same colour it was initially on the board.

piece.name: Knight
piece.description: Knight controls 8 squares on the board from the centre. Each knight can move in an L shape, 3 squares away. A knight can only move on alternating colours.
